member.name: T:PhasorProtocolAdapters.CommonPhasorServices
member.summary: Provides common phasor services.
member.remarks: Typically class should be implemented as a singleton since one instance will suffice.

member.name: M:PhasorProtocolAdapters.CommonPhasorServices.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new .

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.CommonPhasorServices.SupportsTemporalProcessing
member.summary: Gets the flag indicating if this adapter supports temporal processing.
member.remarks: Since the common phasor services is designed to assist in various real-time operations, it is expected that this would not be desired in a temporal data streaming session.

member.summary: Calculates number of data units that were not received at least once from input stream during last reporting interval.

Any needed arguments for statistic calculation.

Protocol independent . Timebase to use for fraction second resolution. The nominal to use for the new . Gets reference to parent instance, if available. A new IEEE C37.118 .

member.param: Source configuration frame.
member.returns: New frame based on source configuration.
member.remarks: This function allow an explicit downcast of a typical IEEE C37.118 configuration type 2 frame to a type 1 frame.

member.name: T:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase
member.summary: Represents an used to generate and transmit concentrated stream of phasor measurements in a specific phasor protocol.

member.name: M:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new .

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.IDCode
member.summary: Gets ID code defined for this parsed from the .

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.AutoPublishConfigurationFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if configuration frame should be automatically published at the top of each minute on the data channel.
member.remarks: By default if no command channel is defined, this flag will be true; otherwise if command channel is defined the flag will be false.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.ReplaceWithSpaceChar
member.summary: Gets or sets character that will be replaced with a space in output labels.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.ActiveConnections
member.summary: Gets the total number of active socket connections.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.AutoStartDataChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if concentrator will automatically start data channel.
member.remarks: By default data channel will be started automatically, setting this flag to false will allow alternate methods of enabling and disabling the real-time data stream (e.g., this can be used to allow a remote to device to enable and disable data stream if the protocol supports such commands).

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.ProcessDataValidFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if the data valid flag assignments should be processed during frame publication.
member.remarks: In cases where client applications ignore the data validity flag, setting this flag to false will provide a slight processing optimization, especially useful on very large data streams.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.NominalFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the nominal defined for this .

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.DataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined for this .
member.remarks: Note that this value represents the default format that will be used if user has not specified a data format for an individual device.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.CoordinateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined for this .
member.remarks: Note that this value represents the default format that will be used if user has not specified a coordinate format for an individual device.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.CurrentScalingValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer scaling value to apply to current values published by this .
member.remarks: Typically only the lower 24-bits will be used to scale current values in 10^5 amperes per bit. Note that this value represents the default value that will be used if user has not specified a value for an individual device.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.VoltageScalingValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer scaling value to apply to voltage values published by this .
member.remarks: Typically only the lower 24-bits will be used to scale voltage values in 10^5 volts per bit. Note that this value represents the default value that will be used if user has not specified a value for an individual device.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.AnalogScalingValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer scaling value to apply to analog values published by this .
member.remarks: Typically only the lower 24-bits will be used to scale analog values in 10^5 units per bit. Note that this value represents the default value that will be used if user has not specified a value for an individual device.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.DigitalMaskValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the digital mask value made available in configuration frames for use with digital values published by this .
member.remarks: This value represents two mask words for use with digital status values. In IEEE C37.118 configuration frames, the two 16-bit words that make up a digital mask value are provided for each defined digital word. Note that this value represents the default value that will be used if user has not specified a value for an individual device. The low word will be used to indicate the normal status of the digital inputs by returning a 0 when exclusive ORed (XOR) with the status word. The high word will indicate the current valid inputs to the PMU by having a bit set in the binary position corresponding to the digital input and all other bits set to 0. If digital status words are used for something other than boolean status indications, the use is left to the user.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.MaximumLabelLength
member.summary: Gets the maximum label length for string fields in configuration frames.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.MinimumLatency
member.summary: Gets the minimum latency in milliseconds over the last test interval.

member.summary: Gets the maximum latency in milliseconds over the last test interval.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.AverageLatency
member.summary: Gets the average latency in milliseconds over the last test interval.

member.summary: Gets the current number of known connected clients on the command channel.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.SupportsTemporalProcessing
member.summary: Gets the flag indicating if this adapter supports temporal processing.
member.remarks: Since the concentrator is designed to open sockets and produce data streams, it is expected that this would not be desired in a temporal data streaming session.

member.summary: Starts the , if it is not already running.

member.summary: Stops the .

member.name: M:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.StartDataChannel
member.summary: Starts the real-time data stream.
member.remarks: If is false, this method will allow host administrator to manually start the data channel, thus enabling the real-time data stream. If command channel is defined, it will be unaffected.

member.name: M:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.StopDataChannel
member.summary: Stops the real-time data stream.
member.remarks: This method will allow host administrator to manually stop the data channel, thus disabling the real-time data stream. If command channel is defined, it will be unaffected.

member.name: M:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.AssignMeasurementToFrame(GSF.TimeSeries.IFrame,GSF.TimeSeries.IMeasurement)
member.summary: Assign to its .
member.param: to assign to.
to assign to .
member.returns: true if was successfully assigned to its .
member.remarks: In simple concentration scenarios all you need to do is assign a measurement to its frame based on time. In the case of a phasor data concentrator you need to assign a measurement to its particular location in its - so this method overrides the default behavior in order to accomplish this task.

member.name: M:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorDataConcentratorBase.PublishFrame(GSF.TimeSeries.IFrame,System.Int32)
member.summary: Publish of time-aligned collection of values that arrived within the concentrator's defined .
member.param: of measurements with the same timestamp that arrived within that are ready for processing.
Index of within a second ranging from zero to - 1.

member.summary: Execute the publish operation for a configuration frame.
member.param: Timestamp to use for published configuration frame.
member.remarks: This method allows for custom configuration frame publication, e.g., a config frame that may need to span multiple frames.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorMeasurementMapper.IsConcentrator
member.summary: Gets flag that determines if device being mapped is a concentrator (i.e., data from multiple devices combined together from the connected device).

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorMeasurementMapper.AccessID
member.summary: Gets the access ID (a.k.a, ID code) for this device connection. Value is often necessary in order to make a connection to some phasor protocols.
member.remarks: This value can mutate when configured with multiple values, i.e., where an alternate access ID code is specified for a target device connection, e.g.: accessID=95; server=192.168.1.10:4712,192.168.1.12:4712/96,192.168.2.10:4712,192.168.2.12:4712/96 In this example both 192.168.1.10:4712 and 192.168.2.10:4712 use the configured access ID of 95, but 192.168.1.12:4712/96 and 192.168.2.12:4712/96 specify an access ID of 96.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorMeasurementMapper.DefinedDevices
member.summary: Gets an enumeration of all defined system devices (regardless of ID or label based definition)

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorMeasurementMapper.AllowUseOfCachedConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if use of cached configuration during initial connection is allowed when a configuration has not been received within the data loss interval.

member.summary: Gets the configuration cache file name, with path.

member.summary: Gets or sets time zone of this .
member.remarks: If time zone of clock of connected device is not set to UTC, assigning this property with proper time zone will allow proper adjustment.

member.name: P:PhasorProtocolAdapters.PhasorMeasurementMapper.TimeAdjustmentTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets ticks used to manually adjust time of this .
member.remarks: This property will allow for precise time adjustments of connected devices should this be needed.
